Text.Title: Keyboard Shortcuts
Text.Description: These are keyboard shortcuts for MacOS. If you aren't currently using linux you probably will in a future job. Also these can easily be converted to windows shortcuts using ChatGPT.

Shortcuts.Action: Undo an action
Redo an action
Save changes in a file
Save all changed files in a folder
Clear a terminal
Go to top of document
Go to bottom of document
Screenshot on mac

Shortcuts.Shortcut: command + shift + 5 + Press Record Entire Screen
Shortcuts.Action: Screen record on a mac.
Hyperlink Text
Search for a word in a webpage.
Show all open windows on mac
Copy and paste an item
Show hidden files in a folder/directory.
Cancel an operation in terminal
Suspend an operation in terminal (I use this if control + c isn't working)
Deletes the entire line youâ€™re typing in the terminal
Open Finder (with the open button, so you can open files without having to double click)
Open emoji keyboard menu

Shortcuts.Shortcut: control + command + space bar, then click keyboard
Shortcuts.Action: Gets math and other special characters by first opening emoji keyboard menu, then in the upper right hand corner click on the little keyboard icon

Shortcuts.Shortcut: control + right click google doc table Table Properties -> Color -> Table Border -> Select White
Shortcuts.Action: Make the columns of a google doc table invisible. This will be helpful for the CSC 385 final paper.
Create a superscript in google doc
Create a subscript in google doc
Create a new terminal/command prompt
Create new window in terminal
Select all files in a directory in Finder
Press to start and save crop of a screenshot on mac
Bold/unbold text in TextEdit on mac
